author: popef
content: If the peer sampling is dropped, how do you validate the availability of the past blocks? I know that you can still validate the current block, but how about the past blocks? cc: <@520034910149410861>

author: fradamt
content: It's the same for the current block or for past blocks, in either case you do custody

author: .fjl
content: But I think what Pop means is, you won't be getting the columns delivered by gossip for older blocks. You will only get the new columns for new blocks.

author: .fjl
content: With sampling it's more of an active process of checking if the data is still live with some confidence. You can do that for older data as well.

author: fradamt
content: You would do the same that you do today when syncing blobs over the custody period, just only for the subnets you were assigned to

author: .fjl
content: Ahh, so there will be a way of requesting columns basically?

author: fradamt
content: Yeah, this is the relevant bit in the spec https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/_features/eip7594/p2p-interface.md#datacolumnsidecarsbyrange-v1

author: jimmygchen
content: Is there any appetite for prototyping 2D PeerDAS? Perhaps a naive and crazy idea, but I'm curious to see how much work it is to do this from the beginning vs having to take care of the transition from 1D to 2D PeerDAS. I think it might be a bit messy having to have the code for both 1D and 2D for a period of time, and also having to touch every part of peerdas code again (reconstruction, validator custody, custody groups) when we get there - we'll essentially need to maintain both 1D and 2D logic in every part of the PeerDAS code.
